verses.verse: At this<WH2063> also<WH637> my heart<WH3820> trembles,<WH2729> and is moved<WH5425> out of his place.<WH4725>
Hear<WH8085> attentively<WH8085> the noise<WH7267> of his voice,<WH6963> and the sound<WH1899> that goes<WH3318> out of his mouth.<WH6310>
He directs<WH3474> it under<WH8478> the whole<WH3605> heaven,<WH8064> and his lightning<WH216> to the ends<WH3671> of the earth.<WH776>
After<WH310> it a voice<WH6963> roars:<WH7580> he thunders<WH7481> with the voice<WH6963> of his excellency;<WH1347> and he will not stay<WH6117> them when<WH3588> his voice<WH6963> is heard.<WH8085>
God<WH410> thunders<WH7481> marvelously<WH6381> with his voice;<WH6963> great<WH1419> things does<WH6213> he, which we cannot<WH408> comprehend.<WH3045>
For he said<WH559> to the snow,<WH7950> Be you on the earth;<WH776> likewise to the small rain,<WH1653> and to the great<WH4306> rain<WH1653> of his strength.<WH5797>
He seals<WH2856> up the hand<WH3027> of every<WH3605> man;<WH120> that all<WH3605> men<WH582> may know<WH3045> his work.<WH4639>
Then the beasts<WH2416> go<WH935> into<WH1119> dens,<WH695> and remain<WH7931> in their places.<WH4585>
Out of the south<WH2315> comes<WH935> the whirlwind:<WH5492> and cold<WH7135> out of the north.<WH4215>
By the breath<WH5397> of God<WH410> frost<WH7140> is given:<WH5414> and the breadth<WH7341> of the waters<WH4325> is straitened.<WH4164>
Also<WH637> by watering<WH7377> he wearies<WH2959> the thick cloud:<WH5645> he scatters<WH6327> his bright<WH216> cloud:<WH6051>

And it is turned<WH2015> round<WH4524> about by his counsels:<WH8458> that they may do<WH6467> whatever<WH3605> <WH834> he commands<WH6680> them on the face<WH6440> of the world<WH8398> in the earth.<WH776>
He causes it to come,<WH4672> whether<WH518> for correction,<WH7626> or for his land,<WH776> or for mercy.<WH2617>
Listen<WH238> to this,<WH2063> O Job:<WH347> stand<WH5975> still,<WH5975> and consider<WH995> the wondrous<WH6381> works of God.<WH410>
Do you know<WH3045> when God<WH433> disposed<WH7760> them, and caused the light<WH216> of his cloud<WH6051> to shine?<WH3313>
Do you know<WH3045> the balancing<WH4657> of the clouds,<WH5645> the wondrous<WH4652> works of him which is perfect<WH8549> in knowledge?<WH1843>
How<WH834> your garments<WH899> are warm,<WH2525> when he quiets<WH8252> the earth<WH776> by the south<WH1864> wind?
Have you with him spread<WH7554> out the sky,<WH7834> which is strong,<WH2389> and as a molten<WH3332> looking<WH7209> glass?<WH7209>
Teach<WH3045> us what<WH4100> we shall say<WH559> to him; for we cannot<WH3808> order<WH6186> our speech by reason<WH6440> of darkness.<WH2822>
Shall it be told<WH5608> him that I speak?<WH1696> if<WH518> a man<WH376> speak,<WH559> surely<WH3588> he shall be swallowed<WH1104> up.
And now<WH6258> men see<WH7200> not the bright<WH925> light<WH216> which<WH1931> is in the clouds:<WH7834> but the wind<WH7307> passes,<WH5674> and cleans<WH2891> them.
Fair<WH2091> weather<WH2091> comes<WH857> out of the north:<WH6828> with God<WH433> is terrible<WH3372> majesty.<WH1935>

Touching the Almighty,<WH7706> we cannot<WH3808> find<WH4672> him out: he is excellent<WH7689> in power,<WH3581> and in judgment,<WH4941> and in plenty<WH7230> of justice:<WH6666> he will not afflict.<WH6031>
Men<WH582> do therefore<WH3651> fear<WH3372> him: he respects<WH7200> not any that are wise<WH2450> of heart.<WH3820>
